841eb107-092c-464a-9a27-b47921713216.description: The CISA certification is world-renowned as the standard of achievement for those who audit, control, monitor and assess an organization’s information technology and business systems.
841eb107-092c-464a-9a27-b47921713216.name: Certified Information Systems Auditor® (CISA)

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17024:2003
alignments.description: Principles and requirements for a body certifying persons against specific requirements, and includes the development and maintenance of a certification scheme for persons.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CISA exam
Submit verified evidence of five years work experience in the fields of Information Systems Auditing, Control, Assurance or Security
Agree to abide by the ISACA Code of Professional Ethics
Agree to abide with Information Systems Standards as adopted by ISACA
Agree to abide by the CISA Continuing Professional Education Policy

a55a4919-6407-4395-86af-6a9f621b5d76.description: The management-focused CISM is the globally accepted standard for individuals who design, build and manage enterprise information security programs.
a55a4919-6407-4395-86af-6a9f621b5d76.name: Certified Information Security Manager® (CISM)

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17024:2003
alignments.description: Principles and requirements for a body certifying persons against specific requirements, and includes the development and maintenance of a certification scheme for persons.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CISM exam

Submit verified evidence of five years of information security work experience, with a minimum of three years of information security management work experience in three or more of the job practice domains
Agree to abide by the ISACA Code of Professional Ethics
Agree to abide by the CISM Continuing Professional Education Policy

2950e840-e1ab-441d-96e9-cf4de933c6a8.description: CRISC is the only certification that positions IT professionals for future career growth by linking IT risk management to enterprise risk management, and positioning them to become strategic partners to the business.
2950e840-e1ab-441d-96e9-cf4de933c6a8.name: Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control™ (CRISC)

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17024:2003
alignments.description: Principles and requirements for a body certifying persons against specific requirements, and includes the development and maintenance of a certification scheme for persons.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CRISC exam
Submit verified evidence of three years of work experience in the fields of risk management and information system (IS) control
A minimum of at least three (3) years of cumulative work experience performing the tasks of a CRISC professional across at least three (3) CRISC domains is required for certification
Agree to abide by the CRISC Continuing Professional Education Policy

b9be5ede-c014-4adf-b1d0-a84c6f3bec9f.description: The CDPSE certification is focused on the technical implementation of privacy solutions and privacy-enhanced design. CDPSE holders are integral to an organization's privacy program and can facilitate a common understanding of best practices throughout the organization.
b9be5ede-c014-4adf-b1d0-a84c6f3bec9f.name: Certified Data Privacy Solutions Engineer™ (CDPSE™)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CDPSE exam
Submit verified evidence of professional work experience in two or more of the exam content outline domains
Agree to abide by the ISACA Code of Professional Ethics
Agree to abide by the CDPSE Continuing Professional Education Policy

0155ac64-53fb-4b46-a967-f0fbf8149484.description: CGEIT recognizes a range of professionals for their knowledge and application of enterprise IT governance principles and practices.
0155ac64-53fb-4b46-a967-f0fbf8149484.name: Certified in the Governance of Enterprise IT® (CGEIT)

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17024:2003
alignments.description: Principles and requirements for a body certifying persons against specific requirements, and includes the development and maintenance of a certification scheme for persons.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CGEIT exam

Submit verified evidence of five years of work experience serving in an advisory or oversight role, and/or otherwise supporting the governance of the IT-related contribution to an enterprise is required to apply for certification
Agree to abide by the ISACA Code of Professional Ethics
Agree to abide by the CGEIT Continuing Professional Education Policy

c365fca5-d558-4002-b306-97f7150ce3a6.description: Earners of this certificate have completed an exam that demonstrates knowledge aligned with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education (NICE), which is compatible with global cybersecurity issues, activities and job roles.
c365fca5-d558-4002-b306-97f7150ce3a6.name: CSX Cybersecurity Fundamentals Certificate

alignments.name: National Initiative For Cybersecurity Education (NICE)
alignments.description: The goal of NICE is to establish an operational, sustainable and continually improving cybersecurity education program for the nation to use sound cyber practices that will enhance the nation’s security.

alignments.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
alignments.description: NIST is a non-regulatory federal agency within the U.S. Department of Commerce. NIST's mission is to promote U.S. innovation and industrial competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and technology in ways that enhance economic security and improve our quality of life.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CSX Cybersecurity Certificate exam

85b895e1-4047-4162-9722-c4a6e81c1845.description: Earners of the COBIT 2019 Foundation Certificate have successfully demonstrated a comprehensive knowledge of the COBIT 2019 principles, concepts and methodologies used to establish, enhance and maintain a system for effective governance and management of enterprise information and technology.
85b895e1-4047-4162-9722-c4a6e81c1845.name: COBIT® 2019 Foundation Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare for COBIT 2019 Foundation exam (training or self-study)
Take and pass COBIT 2019 Foundation exam with 65% or higher

d3df0d93-d7eb-429a-9a05-9e4aba21f6c0.description: Earners of this certificate have completed an exam that demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of risk, controls and security knowledge necessary to perform cybersecurity audits and critical to an organization’s cybersecurity program.
d3df0d93-d7eb-429a-9a05-9e4aba21f6c0.name: ISACA® Cybersecurity Audit Certificate

alignments.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
alignments.description: NIST is a US government entity that creates mandatory standards that are followed by federal agencies and those doing business with them. NIST develops tests, test methods, reference data, proof-of concept implementations, and technical analyses to advance the development and productive use of information technology.

alignments.name: NIST Cybersecurity Core Framework Controls
alignments.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework 1.0 is voluntary guidance, based on existing standards, guidelines, and practices for organizations to better manage and reduce cybersecurity risk. It was designed to foster risk and cybersecurity management communications amongst both internal and external organizational stakeholders.

alignments.name: Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies (COBIT 5)
alignments.description: COBIT 5 is the leading framework for the governance and management of enterprise IT. Issued by ISACA, COBIT is a comprehensive framework aligned with globally accepted practices, analytical tools and models that can help any enterprise address business issues through governance and management of information and technology.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the ISACA® Cybersecurity Audit Certificate exam

1c063f16-df12-408c-ab36-4f01614eadee.description: Earners of this certification have completed an exam that demonstrates their firewall, patching, and anti-virus experience, as well as their ability to implement common security controls, perform vulnerability scans, and some network analysis.
1c063f16-df12-408c-ab36-4f01614eadee.name: Cybersecurity Practitioner Certification

alignments.name: National Initiative For Cybersecurity Education (NICE)
alignments.description: The goal of NICE is to establish an operational, sustainable and continually improving cybersecurity education program for the nation to use sound cyber practices that will enhance the nation’s security.

alignments.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
alignments.description: NIST is a non-regulatory federal agency within the U.S. Department of Commerce. NIST's mission is to promote U.S. innovation and industrial competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and technology in ways that enhance economic security and improve our quality of life.

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the CSX Practitioner Certification exam

acaa4036-2d6b-4eba-b36e-e2e26c045a50.description: The Certificate in Cloud Auditing Knowledge (CCAK), brought to you by Cloud Security Alliance® (CSA), a global leader in cloud security research, training, and credentialing, and ISACA®, a global leader in training, education, and certification for IS/IT professionals. This certificate fills a gap in the market for vendor-neutral, technical education for IT audit, security, and risk professionals to understand unique cloud terminology, challenges, and solutions.
acaa4036-2d6b-4eba-b36e-e2e26c045a50.name: Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge

badge_template_activities.title: Candidates who attained the CCAK certificate should have completed some training - either through CSA or ISACA or accredited training organizations - and passed the CCAK exam. There is no set number of training hours, however, to attain the credential, the candidate should be aware of nuances in terminology and challenges in cloud audit and assurance and be able to pass the exam.

2a43d216-a692-4412-bb74-dc7952742772.description: The Cybersecurity Fundamentals Certificate contains Hybrid learning so therefore is comprised of both practice or knowledge-based learning (multiple choice traditional format exam) a performance or skills-based learning (live labs in a virtual environment)
2a43d216-a692-4412-bb74-dc7952742772.name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: The Cybersecurity Fundamentals Certificate contains Hybrid learning so therefore is comprised of both practice or knowledge-based learning (multiple choice traditional format exam) a performance or skills-based learning (live labs in a virtual environment)

0bc24565-90e4-442b-99ea-cc3e363c3025.description: Earners of the COBIT 2019 Design & Implementation Certificate have successfully demonstrated a comprehensive knowledge of COBIT and can apply it to specific business problems, pain points, trigger events and risk scenarios within the organization. They are able to implement and apply COBIT and effectively use it for client initiatives.
0bc24565-90e4-442b-99ea-cc3e363c3025.name: COBIT® 2019 Design & Implementation Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare for COBIT 2019 Design & Implementation exam (training or self-study)
Take and pass COBIT 2019 Design & Implementation exam with 60% or higher

8f938505-d918-47d9-8d08-77631910ec7b.description: Earners of this certificate have completed an exam that successfully demonstrates comprehensive fundamental knowledge of basic terminology, concepts, general practices and explanations of risk and I&T-related risk.
8f938505-d918-47d9-8d08-77631910ec7b.name: ISACA® IT Risk Fundamentals Certificate

1ba8f985-c046-4fd3-b504-695f25f368ae.description: ISACA’s Certified in Emerging Technology™ (CET™) Certification program is compromised of four separate certificate programs including: 1. Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals, 2. Blockchain Fundamentals, 3. Cloud Fundamentals, and 4. IoT Fundamentals. To earn the certification requires passing each of the four exams (in any order) and then submitting a completed application form and processing fee.
1ba8f985-c046-4fd3-b504-695f25f368ae.name: Certified in Emerging Technology™ (CET™)

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the certification requires passing each of the four exams (in any order) and then submitting a completed application form and processing fee. Once certified as a CET, certification-holders are required to maintain the certification on an annual basis by earning and reporting CPE hours and paying an annual maintenance fee. More information regarding the recertification requirement can be found in the CET CPE Policy.

1357c19a-842f-4a02-93fd-286af9ea07f3.description: Earners of this certificate have completed an exam that demonstrates both COBIT 2019 and security concepts, and who are involved in importing and/or building the cybersecurity program and their enterprises.
1357c19a-842f-4a02-93fd-286af9ea07f3.name: ISACA® Implementing the NIST Cybersecurity Framework Using COBIT 2019 Certificate

NIST develops tests, test methods, reference data, proof-of concept implementations, and technical analyses to advance the development and productive use of information technology.

alignments.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework 1.0 is voluntary guidance, based on existing standards, guidelines, and practices for organizations to better manage and reduce cybersecurity risk. Prepare for the exam (training or self-study)

ce2f062f-4c2b-4315-9a35-aac582dd71b6.name: Data Science Fundamentals Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Take and pass the exam with a score of 65% or higher and you will be notified of your achievement. You will be able to show off your certificate by downloading it in your MyISACA certificate page.

e7edd55f-5c33-49ab-8d0e-baa9813daaf2.description: ISACA’s Information Technology Certified Associate (ITCA) Certification program is compromised of five separate certificate programs including: 1. Computing Concepts Fundamentals, 2. Networking and Infrastructure Fundamentals, 3. Cybersecurity Fundamentals, 4. Software Development Fundamentals, and 5. Data Science Fundamentals. To earn the certification requires passing each of the five exams (in any order) and then submitting a completed application form and processing fee.
e7edd55f-5c33-49ab-8d0e-baa9813daaf2.name: ISACA® Information Technology Certified Associate™ (ITCA™)

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the certification requires passing each of the five exams (in any order) and then submitting a completed application form and processing fee. Once certified as an ITCA, certification-holders are required to maintain the certification on an annual basis by earning and reporting CPE hours and paying an annual maintenance fee. More information regarding the recertification requirement can be found in the ITCA CPE Policy.

cfaaa012-b5a7-4bbf-a84a-bacc7e7b4167.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the ISACA Cybersecurity: Penetration Testing course. Completion of this course indicates learners have demonstrated an introductory level understanding of penetration testing.
cfaaa012-b5a7-4bbf-a84a-bacc7e7b4167.name: ISACA Cybersecurity: Penetration Testing

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ISACA Cybersecurity: Penetration Testing training course.
